ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 20A is a 24.2 km hard circular route in the UK, also used as a shortcut for C20. The trail weaves across varied terrain and hills, offering a demanding day's hike with significant elevation changes and long mileage.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including well-worn footpaths, field edges, and occasional rough trails. Expect uneven surfaces, mud, stiles, open exposed sections, and potential water crossings depending on rainfall.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, strenuous hike. Plan for a full day and check local weather; carry a map and compass as navigation aids, and don't rely solely on GPS. Inform someone of your plans and expected return. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers; be prepared for mud, wind, and sudden weather changes. Watch for wildlife, cattle, and flooded sections; take care on stiles and gate transitions. Carry sufficient water and snacks, and have a means of signaling for help (whistle/phone).
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS with offline maps
Phone with emergency contacts and power bank
Emergency blanket or extra insulating layer
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) for daylight and drier conditions; the route can be hiked in winter, but expect mud, colder temperatures, and reduced daylight.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 20A (C20 Short-Cut) – 24.2 km Hard Circular Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the ACW Circular Walk 20A, a demanding 24.2 km loop in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, and gear to prepare for this hard circular hike.
